__e: Miss Smith, I was married many years ago... to a woman whose life was lost to illness... just three years after the birth of our son, Frank.
You weren't the little girl you were when I left here.
The young lady for whom you've come to care so deeply--
You can play damsel in distress all you want, but I'm getting us out of here.
I guess all that's missing from this story is the girl, the damsel in distress, and the villain, but we'll get to that.

That's exactly what I expect you to do, because you're not always the guy that has to jump in and do something, and I'm not a damsel in distress.And if your last bar brawl didn't make it clear enough, you're not superman.
